Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip and lower wall glazed; animal frieze in handle zone: confronting ram and panther preserved (of ram, head with traces of horns in added white and neck in added red remain; panther complete save part of head and part of tail missing; red on shoulder and haunches).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1373) (phase 3)
